comments.body: @edoardocomar Since this PR is using the same config as https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/4485, it will need to get merged on top of that right?
We copied all common files from #4485 (at the same time addressing the points we raised there) so they can be merged in any order.
@guozhangwang @hachikuji I think we can do this without a KIP, but I would like to very with you.

Should I add `DOC`s for `DEFAULT_LIST_KEY/VALUE_SERDE_INNER_CLASS` configs? 

I was looking at `DEFAULT_WINDOWED_KEY/VALUE_SERDE_INNER_CLASS` configs in `StreamsConfig` class, and they don't have docs underneath them.
Sound like something we should fix, ie, add corresponding DOC entries to `StreamsConfig`
Seems this variable is still misssing the corresponding DOC string? (Same for `DEFAULT_LIST_VALUE_SERDE_INNER_CLASS` below)

`Note when list serde class is used` -> seems be a little fuzzy if one does not know the context. It might be better to be very explicit. What about: ``` "Default class for keys (that are of type java.util.List) that implements the java.util.List interface. " + "This config is only effective if configuration parameter " + DEFAULT_KEY_SERDE_CLASS_CONFIG + " is set to " + ListSerde.class.getName() + " and determines the concrete List-type (eg, LinkedList, ArrayList etc.) that is instantiated during deserialization. " + "Note that you also need to set the inner serde class (for the list elements) that implements the org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde interface via " + DEFAULT_LIST_KEY_SERDE_INNER_CLASS + " configuration parameter." ``` We should be similarly explicit, for the "inner serde" configs.
`DEFAULT_KEY_SERDE_CLASS_CONFIG` is not accessible from `ComminClientConfigs` since it lives in `StreamsConfig`, the same applies for `ListSerde.class.getName()`

diffHunk: @@ -1,1 +130,134 @@ public static final String DEFAULT_LIST_KEY_SERDE_TYPE_CLASS_DOC = "Default class for key that implements the java.util.List interface. " + "This configuration will be read if and only if default.key.serde configuration is set to org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serdes.ListSerde " + "Note when list serde class is used, one needs to set the inner serde class that implements the org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde interface via '" + DEFAULT_LIST_KEY_SERDE_INNER_CLASS + "'";
